#Text=Derby
#Text=Derby ( pronounced DAR-bee ) is a city in Derbyshire , England .

#Text=Purportedly the UK 's most ' central ' city and promoted as a base for exploring the Peak District , Derby also boasts modern shopping facilities and a number of visitor attractions in and around the surrounding area .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Derby was the site of Lombe 's Mill , the first fully mechanised factory in the world , built in 1721 .
#Text=Railway engineering starting in 1840 in Derby , and continued with the Derby Carriage and Wagon Works .
#Text=The city is now the site of the UK 's only remaining locomotive manufacturer .
#Text=Rolls-Royce opened a car and aircraft factory in the town in 1907 ; today the aero-engine manufacturer is the largest engineering employer in the area .
#Text=Car maker Toyota has a manufacturing and assembly plant in Burnaston , just south of Derby .
#Text=By plane
#Text=The nearest airport is ( EMA ) .
#Text=The Skylink Derby bus runs from the airport to Derby and is operated by Kinchbus .
#Text=The Skylink service runs every 30 minutes during the daytime and hourly at other times ( with a 24 hour service ) , and also serves Leicester .
#Text=By train
#Text=has good rail links .
#Text=East Midlands Trains operates express trains from London St Pancras , Leicester and Sheffield .
#Text=It also runs local services to destinations including Nottingham , Matlock , Stoke-on-Trent and to parts of Lincolnshire .
#Text=Crosscountry operates services to the North East , Scotland , the South West , the South Coast and the West Midlands .
#Text=Train times are available from National Rail Enquiries ( +44 8457 484950 ) .
#Text=By bus
#Text=is served by coaches operated by National Express from around the country .
#Text=The ' Comet ' bus service by Trent Barton connects the city to Chesterfield while the ' Red Arrow ' runs to Nottingham at very regular intervals on weekdays and weekends .
#Text=The ' Transpeak ' bus service by High Peak connects Derby with the Peak District and Manchester .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Most local bus services are operated by Arriva and Trent Barton .
#Text=See the Derbyshire County Council public transport website for timetables and information for all buses .
#Text=Though be warned , public transport in the city is not particularly good value , especially compared to similar cities .
#Text=There are two park and ride services running from Meteor Centre in the north and Pride Park in the east .
#Text=On foot
#Text=Derby is a compact city making it very approachable for pedestrians .
#Text=Derby walking directions can be planned on-line with the walkit.com walking route planner .
#Text=See
#Text=Derby Market Hall , The Market Place , DE1 2FS , ☏ +441332255653 .
#Text=9AM-5:30PM .
#Text=This Grade-II listed building is the work of Melbourne engineer Rowland Mason Ordish , and was completed in 1866 .
#Text=The magnificent ironwork roof is not to be missed .
#Text=There is also a fantastic range of stalls selling everything from fresh fruit and veg to mobile phones and Japanese comic books .
#Text=The hall is undergoing renovation , but remains fully accessible .
#Text=Derby Arboretum .
#Text=England 's first public park , deeded to the town of Derby in 1840 .
#Text=Royal Crown Derby , 194 Osmaston Road , ☏ +441332712800 .
#Text=A factory producing fine china , part of Derby 's history .
#Text=Contact the factory to schedule a tour .
#Text=Museum of Making ( formerly the Silk Mill , and Derby Industrial Museum ) , Silk Mill Lane , ☏ +441332255308 .
#Text=closed for renovations .
#Text=The museum is due to open in summer 2020 .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Derby Museum and Art Gallery , The Strand , ☏ +441332716659 , fax : +441332716670 .
#Text=Tu - Sa 10AM-5PM , Su non-4PM , Bank Holidays closed .
#Text=Features collections of porcelain created in Derby since 1750 .
#Text=Other displays include archaeology , military history , geology and natural history .
#Text=The art gallery has a large collection of paintings by Joseph Wright of Derby .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Pickford 's House , 41 Friargate , ☏ +441332255363 .
#Text=M 11AM-5PM , Tu - Sa 10AM-5PM , Su 2-5PM , holidays 2PM-5PM .
#Text=Unique museum of Georgian life and historic costume .
#Text=Well worth visiting .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Derby Cathedral , Cathedral Centre : 18-19 Iron Gate , Derby DE1 3GP , ☏ +441332341201 .

#Text=Though not one of the most spectacular of English cathedrals ( it was a " mere " parish church until 1927 ) , the cathedral has an impressive 16th-century tower ( which is occasionally open for some spectacular views across Derby ) ; most of the rest is early Georgian , with an east-end extension in matching style completed in 1972 .

#Text=Highlights include a painted wrought-iron screen by the renowned local smith Robert Bakewell ( 1682–1751 ) and memorials to Bess of Hardwick , Georgiana , Duchess of Devonshire and Florence Nightingale .

#Text=Peregrine Falcons have nested on the tower for several years and volunteers are on hand with telescopes for viewing during spring and early summer ( go to http://derbyperegrines.blogspot.co.uk/ for current dates ) .
#Text=St Mary 's Chapel , Bridge Gate .
#Text=14th-century bridge chapel , one of the oldest surviving buildings in Derby and one of the few surviving bridge chapels in England .
#Text=A picturesque little building next to the River Derwent , still hosting regular services but with limited opening times otherwise .
#Text=Derby Gaol , 50-51 Friar Gate , ☏ +448000277928 .
#Text=Elvaston Castle Country Park , Borrowash Road , Elvaston .
#Text=321 acres of open parkland , woodland and more formal historical gardens surrounding a 19th-century Gothic Revival castle .
#Text=Has in the last few years been lacking attention and investment .
#Text=Kedleston Hall , near Quarndon , DE22 5JH , ☏ +441332842191 , ✉ kedlestonhall@nationaltrust.org.uk .
#Text=The home of the Curzon family which was constructed in 1759 .

#Text=This neoclassical hall had particular controversy as the Curzon 's forced the village of Kedleston to relocate several miles away with the exception of the All Saints ' church which stayed put .
#Text=Further information on things to see and do is available from the Derby Tourist Information Centre in the Market Place .
#Text=Do
#Text=Go on a ghost walk in the UK 's second ' most haunted ' town .
#Text=For example : Derby ghost walks , Friargate and Cathedral Quarter .
#Text=Darley Park walk .
#Text=Take a walk up the Derwent to Darley Park
#Text=Watch football ie soccer at Derby County FC , Pride Park , Royal Way DE24 8XL , ☏ +441332667532 .
#Text=They play in the Championship , the second tier of English football .
#Text=Pride Park Stadium , capacity 33,000 , is off A6 at the southeast edge of town .
#Text=Derbyshire County Cricket Club , Grandstand Road .
#Text=Watch a game of cricket
#Text=Derby Live - Guildhall Theatre and other city centre venues , Market Place , ☏ +441332255800 .
#Text=Music , touring theatre and other live performances
#Text=QUAD , Market Place , ☏ +441332290606 .
#Text=2-screen cinema , gallery , café bar , workshop , BFI Mediatheque .
#Text=Derby Theatre , 15 Theatre Walk , St Peter 's Quarter , ☏ +441332593939 .
#Text=In-house and touring productions
#Text=Déda , Chapel Street , ☏ +441332370911 .
#Text=Dance performances and classes , also events by other organisations
#Text=Markeaton Park .
#Text=Public park with children 's playground and paddling pool , crazy golf and craft village .
#Text=The Roundhouse ( Derby College ) , Roundhouse Road , Pride Park .
#Text=The oldest railway turning shed in the world is now a location for public and private events .
#Text=Tours of the building are also available at prearranged times .
